elements.content: A one pot reaction of MnCl2, acetylene dicarboxylate (C4O4 2-), and 1,2-bis(4-pyridyl)ethane (bpe) leads to a compound formulated as [{Mn(bpe)(H2O)4}(C4O4)·4.5H2O] and has been shown by single crystal structure analysis to be a three-dimensional network with hexagonal and rhombohedral channels encapsulating C4O4 2- and water molecules, constructed by the one-dimensional “sinusoidal” [Mn(bpe)(H2O)4] n 2+ cationic chains through extensive hydrogen-bonding and π−π interactions.
elements.clean_text: A one pot reaction of MnCl2, acetylene dicarboxylate (C4O4 2-), and 1,2-bis(4-pyridyl)ethane (bpe) leads to a compound formulated as [{Mn(bpe)(H2O)4}(C4O4)⋅4.5H2O] and has been shown by single crystal structure analysis to be a three-dimensional network with hexagonal and rhombohedral channels encapsulating C4O4 2- and water molecules, constructed by the one-dimensional "sinusoidal" [Mn(bpe)(H2O)4] n  2+ cationic chains through extensive hydrogen-bonding and π-π interactions.

elements.content: The reaction of MnCl2, acetylene dicarboxylate (C4O4 2-), and 1,2-bis(4-pyridyl)ethane (bpe) leads to a compound formulated as [{Mn(bpe)(H2O)4}(C4O4)·4.5H2O] and has been shown by single crystal structure analysis to be a three-dimensional network with hexagonal and rhombohedral channels encapsulating C4O4 2- and water molecules, constructed by the one-dimensional “sinusoidal” [Mn(bpe)(H2O)4] n 2+ cationic chains through noncovalent hydrogen-bonding and π−π interactions.
elements.clean_text: The reaction of MnCl2, acetylene dicarboxylate (C4O4 2-), and 1,2-bis(4-pyridyl)ethane (bpe) leads to a compound formulated as [{Mn(bpe)(H2O)4}(C4O4)⋅4.5H2O] and has been shown by single crystal structure analysis to be a three-dimensional network with hexagonal and rhombohedral channels encapsulating C4O4 2- and water molecules, constructed by the one-dimensional "sinusoidal" [Mn(bpe)(H2O)4] n  2+ cationic chains through noncovalent hydrogen-bonding and π-π interactions.

elements.content: The molecular self-assembly organized by covalent or noncovalent interactions (such as hydrogen-bonding or π−π interactions, etc.) is an attractive approach in material science for the fabrication and design of new compounds with potentially useful properties for relevant scientific and technological applications. The major effort is being directed toward the synthesis of functional materials for transport of energy, charge, ions, and molecules. The latter includes nanoporous molecular-based solids, which reveal structural and functional similarities to the inorganic zeolites. The current research on the generation of such frameworks is directed toward synthesizing and using metal atoms or clusters of known geometry to connect them by rigid spacers into the desired structures as demonstrated by Robson, Yaghi et al., and others. In contrast to rigid organic spacers, a judicial use of the flexible ligands may be useful in the formation of an open framework with different nodal geometry but also the properties that exhibit reversible guest exchange and possibly higher selective catalytic activity. The 1,2-bis(4-pyridyl)ethane (bpe) ligand, due to its flexible conformation, has met recently a considerable relevance for the construction of solid state architectures. Among the solid state structures reported so far containing this ligand, most are one-dimensional (1D) polymers and two-dimensional (2D) nets, and in some cases, the dimensionality is enlarged to three-dimensions (3D) through H-bonds. On the other hand, to our knowledge, the only examples of 3D covalently bonded networks containing bpe ligands include copper (Cu:bpe, metal:ligand = 1:2), manganese (Mn:bpe 6:2), and cobalt (Co:bpe 5:9).
elements.clean_text: The molecular self-assembly organized by covalent or noncovalent interactions (such as hydrogen-bonding or π-π interactions, etc.) is an attractive approach in material science for the fabrication and design of new compounds with potentially useful properties for relevant scientific and technological applications. The major effort is being directed toward the synthesis of functional materials for transport of energy, charge, ions, and molecules. The latter includes nanoporous molecular-based solids, which reveal structural and functional similarities to the inorganic zeolites. The current research on the generation of such frameworks is directed toward synthesizing and using metal atoms or clusters of known geometry to connect them by rigid spacers into the desired structures as demonstrated by Robson, Yaghi et al., and others. In contrast to rigid organic spacers, a judicial use of the flexible ligands may be useful in the formation of an open framework with different nodal geometry but also the properties that exhibit reversible guest exchange and possibly higher selective catalytic activity. The 1,2-bis(4-pyridyl)ethane (bpe) ligand, due to its flexible conformation, has met recently a considerable relevance for the construction of solid state architectures. Among the solid state structures reported so far containing this ligand, most are one-dimensional (1D) polymers and two-dimensional (2D) nets, and in some cases, the dimensionality is enlarged to three-dimensions (3D) through H-bonds. On the other hand, to our knowledge, the only examples of 3D covalently bonded networks containing bpe ligands include copper (Cu:bpe, metal:ligand = 1:2), manganese (Mn:bpe 6:2), and cobalt (Co:bpe 5:9).

elements.content: The present compound represents a unprecedented 3D honeycomb-like architecture constructed from a novel sinusoidal 1D chain (Scheme ), [Mn(bpe)(H2O)4]2+, through H-bonding and π−π interactions (Scheme ), and this topology comprises the hexagonal- and rhombohedral-shaped pore in the crystal lattice. It contains the acetylene dicarboxylate and water molecules in the hexagonal and rhombohedral pore while bpe is used as a bidentate bridging ligand.
elements.clean_text: The present compound represents a unprecedented 3D honeycomb-like architecture constructed from a novel sinusoidal 1D chain (Scheme ), [Mn(bpe)(H2O)4]2+, through H-bonding and π-π interactions (Scheme ), and this topology comprises the hexagonal- and rhombohedral-shaped pore in the crystal lattice. It contains the acetylene dicarboxylate and water molecules in the hexagonal and rhombohedral pore while bpe is used as a bidentate bridging ligand.

elements.content:
<fig fig-type="scheme" id="cg025574ph00001" orientation="portrait" position="float">
<label>1</label>
<graphic orientation="portrait" position="float" xlink:href="cg025574ph00001.tif"></graphic>
</fig>

<fig fig-type="scheme" id="cg025574ph00002" orientation="portrait" position="float">
<label>2</label>
<graphic orientation="portrait" position="float" xlink:href="cg025574ph00002.tif"></graphic>
</fig>

Reaction of MnCl2, K2(O2CC⋮CCO2), and bpe (1:1:1) in H2O−MeOH results in the formation of light yellow single crystals by slow evaporation of the reaction mixture at room temperature. The elemental analyses confirm the formula as [{Mn(bpe)(H2O)4}(C4O4)·4.5H2O] (1). The IR spectra of the complex show a broad band in the region of 3300−3500 cm-1, which can be assigned to the stretching vibrations, ν(O−H), of the water molecules. The [νas(OCO)] and [νs(OCO)] appear at 1619 and 1333 cm-1, respectively, which is indicative that the acetylene dicarboxylate is not coordinated to Mn(II) centers.
elements.clean_text: Reaction of MnCl2, K2(O2CC⋮CCO2), and bpe (1:1:1) in H2O-MeOH results in the formation of light yellow single crystals by slow evaporation of the reaction mixture at room temperature. The elemental analyses confirm the formula as [{Mn(bpe)(H2O)4}(C4O4)⋅4.5H2O] (1). The IR spectra of the complex show a broad band in the region of 3300-3500 cm-1, which can be assigned to the stretching vibrations, ν(O-H), of the water molecules. The [νas(OCO)] and [νs(OCO)] appear at 1619 and 1333 cm-1, respectively,  which is indicative that the acetylene dicarboxylate is not coordinated to Mn(II) centers.

elements.content: X-ray crystallographic data reveal that complex 1 is made up of 1D sinusoidal [Mn(bpe)(H2O)4] n 2+ cationic chains, solvated water molecules, and C4O4 2- anions. In the 1D coordination chain, each manganese(II) is attached with the four water molecules and two bridging bpe ligands with MnO4N2 chromophore (Figure ). The four water molecules (O1W, O1W*, O2W, and O2W*) form the equatorial plane around each slightly distorted octahedral Mn(II) [Mn−O1W, 2.1954(17) Å; Mn−O2W, 2.1539(18) Å], and the trans axial positions are occupied by the N1 and symmetry-related counterpart N1* from the two bpe ligands [Mn−N1, 2.271(2) Å]. The slight distortion of each Mn(II) is reflected on the cisoid angles [87.21(7)−92−79(7)°]. The intrachain Mn...Mn separation is 9.487(4) Å.
elements.clean_text: X-ray crystallographic data reveal that complex 1 is made up of 1D sinusoidal [Mn(bpe)(H2O)4] n  2+ cationic chains, solvated water molecules, and C4O4 2- anions. In the 1D coordination chain, each manganese(II) is attached with the four water molecules and two bridging bpe ligands with MnO4N2 chromophore (Figure ). The four water molecules (O1W, O1W*, O2W, and O2W*) form the equatorial plane around each slightly distorted octahedral Mn(II) [Mn-O1W, 2.1954(17) Å; Mn-O2W, 2.1539(18) Å], and the trans axial positions are occupied by the N1 and symmetry-related counterpart N1* from the two bpe ligands [Mn-N1, 2.271(2) Å]. The slight distortion of each Mn(II) is reflected on the cisoid angles [87.21(7)-92-79(7)°]. The intrachain Mn...Mn separation is 9.487(4) Å.

elements.content: Fragment of [Mn(bpe)(H2O)4](C4O4)·4.5H2O showing the atom-labeling scheme (30% thermal ellipsoids). Symmetry-generated atoms are indicated by *. Selected bond lengths (Å) and angles (°): Mn−O(1w), 2.1954(17); Mn−O(2w), 2.1539(18); Mn−N(1), 2.271(2); O(1W)−Mn−O(2W), 91.70(7); O(1W)−Mn−N(1), 87.21(7); O(2W)−Mn−N(1), 91.57(8).
elements.clean_text: 1  Fragment of [Mn(bpe)(H2O)4](C4O4)⋅4.5H2O showing the atom-labeling scheme (30% thermal ellipsoids). Symmetry-generated atoms are indicated by *. Selected bond lengths (Å) and angles (°): Mn-O(1w), 2.1954(17); Mn-O(2w), 2.1539(18); Mn-N(1), 2.271(2); O(1W)-Mn-O(2W), 91.70(7); O(1W)-Mn-N(1), 87.21(7); O(2W)-Mn-N(1), 91.57(8).

elements.content: The most interesting feature of 1 is the 3D honeycomb-like molecular network, formed by the 1D chains in a crosslike fashion arrangement at the Mn(II) centers (Figure ). The planes of the bipyridyl rings are offset between the adjacent layers with a face-to-face separation with a center-to-center of 3.945(2) Å and a dihedral angle of 8.130°. The offset of the baricenters separated by a interplanar distance of 3.600(2) Å indicates π−π interaction, which is responsible for the formation of the honeycomb-like network.
elements.clean_text: The most interesting feature of 1 is the 3D honeycomb-like molecular network, formed by the 1D chains in a crosslike fashion arrangement at the Mn(II) centers (Figure ). The planes of the bipyridyl rings are offset between the adjacent layers with a face-to-face separation with a center-to-center of 3.945(2) Å and a dihedral angle of 8.130°. The offset of the baricenters separated by a interplanar distance of 3.600(2) Å indicates π-π interaction, which is responsible for the formation of the honeycomb-like network.

elements.content: (a) Molecular packing diagram of [Mn(bpe)(H2O)4] showing honeycomb-like molecular network with hexagonal channels along [010]; color code:  green, Mn; gray, C; red, O; blue, N. One web-enhanced object shows π−π interactions among different fragments of chains. (b) Space-filling diagram of [Mn(bpe)(H2O)4](C4O4)·4.5H2O showing solvent-filled channels along [010]. C4O4 2- and water solvent are shown in ball-and-stick model (color code:  black, C4O4 2-; magenta, water). (c) Space-filling diagram of [Mn(bpe)(H2O)4](C4O4)·4.5H2O showing only water solvent-filled channels along [001].
elements.clean_text: 2  (a) Molecular packing diagram of [Mn(bpe)(H2O)4] showing honeycomb-like molecular network with hexagonal channels along [010]; color code: green, Mn; gray, C; red, O; blue, N. One web-enhanced object shows π-π interactions among different fragments of chains. (b) Space-filling diagram of [Mn(bpe)(H2O)4](C4O4)⋅4.5H2O showing solvent-filled channels along [010]. C4O4 2- and water solvent are shown in ball-and-stick model (color code: black, C4O4 2-; magenta, water). (c) Space-filling diagram of [Mn(bpe)(H2O)4](C4O4)⋅4.5H2O showing only water solvent-filled channels along [001].

elements.content: The network encapsulates a 3D system of intersecting solvent-filled channels propagating along [100], [010] with hexagonal shape and along [001] with rhombic shape. The hexagonal channels of ca. 10.4 × 8.4 Å2 contain C4O4 2- and water solvent whereas the rhombic channels of 7.4 × 7.4 Å2 contain only water molecules. The amount of void space encapsulated by the network is 4319 Å3, i.e., 44.1% of the unit cell volume.
elements.clean_text: The network encapsulates a 3D system of intersecting solvent-filled channels propagating along [100], [010] with hexagonal shape and along [001] with rhombic shape. The hexagonal channels of ca. 10.4 × 8.4 Å2 contain C4O4 2- and water solvent whereas the rhombic channels of 7.4 × 7.4 Å2 contain only water molecules. The amount of void space encapsulated by the network is 4319 Å3, i.e., 44.1% of the unit cell volume.

elements.content: The channel water molecules and the anions C4O4 2- are H-bonded to the aqua ligand located at the equatorial positions of the Mn(II) ions [OW (ligated)...OW(channel), 2.685(2)−2.925(4) Å; OW (ligated)...O(C4O4 2-), 2.687(3)−2.762(2) Å] [D−H...A, D−H, H...A, D...A, <D−H...A:  O1W−H1W1...O1, 0.8792, 1.9001, 2.762(2), 166.22; O2W−H1W2...O2(i), 0.8756 1.8643, 2.712(3), 162.56; O2W−H2W2...O4W(ii), 1.0639, 1.6620, 2.715(3), 169.68; O1W−H2W1...O5W, 0.8529, 2.1115, 2.868(4), 147.55; symmetry code (i):  −x, −y, −z; (ii) 1/4 − x, 1/4 − y, 1/4 − z]. The pyridyl rings of the bpe ligand are planar and the maximum deviation of any atom (C4) from the ring is 0.008 Å.
elements.clean_text: The channel water molecules and the anions C4O4 2- are H-bonded to the aqua ligand located at the equatorial positions of the Mn(II) ions [OW (ligated)...OW(channel), 2.685(2)-2.925(4) Å; OW (ligated)...O(C4O4 2-), 2.687(3)-2.762(2) Å] [D-H...A, D-H, H...A, D...A, <D-H...A: O1W-H1W1...O1, 0.8792, 1.9001, 2.762(2), 166.22; O2W-H1W2...O2(i), 0.8756 1.8643, 2.712(3), 162.56; O2W-H2W2...O4W(ii), 1.0639, 1.6620, 2.715(3), 169.68; O1W-H2W1...O5W, 0.8529, 2.1115, 2.868(4), 147.55; symmetry code (i): -x, -y, -z; (ii) 1/4 - x, 1/4 - y, 1/4 - z]. The pyridyl rings of the bpe ligand are planar and the maximum deviation of any atom (C4) from the ring is 0.008 Å.

elements.content: The arrangement and stacking behavior of the linear coordination polymers in 1 are notably different from those found in some recently documented 1D coordination polymers (Scheme ). The first is [Cu(4,4‘-bipy)(H2O)3(SO4)]·2H2O, in which chains in the adjacent layers are arranged in a crosslike fashion at the midpoints of the 4,4‘-bipy ligand, resulting in a 3D supramolecular array with rhombic channels running along the c-axis. The second one has rotating chains in the adjacent layers by 60° to provide helical staircase networks. The third one shows parallel stacking of the adjacent chains running parallel and forming the honeycomb-like networks. On the other hand, recently, G. Ciani et al. reported 9e the self-organization of the 1D polymeric chains of [Ag(sebn)](AsF6) (sebn = 1,10-decanedinitrile) where the chains extend in three noncoplanar directions resulting in a 3D network. However, the complex 1 shows a new type of topology with hexagonal and rhombohedral cross-linking arrangement, which has not been reported in the literature to date.
elements.clean_text: The arrangement and stacking behavior of the linear coordination polymers in 1 are notably different from those found in some recently documented 1D coordination polymers (Scheme ). The first is [Cu(4,4‘-bipy)(H2O)3(SO4)]⋅2H2O, in which chains in the adjacent layers are arranged in a crosslike fashion at the midpoints of the 4,4‘-bipy ligand, resulting in a 3D supramolecular array with rhombic channels running along the c-axis. The second one has rotating chains in the adjacent layers by 60° to provide helical staircase networks. The third one shows parallel stacking of the adjacent chains running parallel and forming the honeycomb-like networks. On the other hand, recently, G. Ciani et al. reported 9e the self-organization of the 1D polymeric chains of [Ag(sebn)](AsF6) (sebn = 1,10-decanedinitrile) where the chains extend in three noncoplanar directions resulting in a 3D network. However, the complex 1 shows a new type of topology with hexagonal and rhombohedral cross-linking arrangement, which has not been reported in the literature to date.

elements.content:
<fig fig-type="scheme" id="cg025574ph00003" orientation="portrait" position="float">
<label>3</label>
<graphic orientation="portrait" position="float" xlink:href="cg025574ph00003.tif"></graphic>
</fig>

Thermogravimetric analysis reveals that the complex 1 loses all of the coordinated and crystalline water molecules in the temperature range of ∼75−125 °C and the dehydrated compound remains stable up to ∼160 °C and then upon further heating decomposes to unidentified products. The dehydrated compound does not revert, keeping it in humid atmosphere (RH ∼ 60%).
elements.clean_text: Thermogravimetric analysis reveals that the complex 1 loses all of the coordinated and crystalline water molecules in the temperature range of ~75-125 °C and the dehydrated compound remains stable up to ~160 °C and then upon further heating decomposes to unidentified products. The dehydrated compound does not revert, keeping it in humid atmosphere (RH ~ 60%).

elements.content: Experimental Section. An aqueous solution (5 mL) of MnCl2·4H2O (1 mmol, 0.197 g) was mixed with an aqueous solution (5 mL) of dipotassium salt of acetylene dicarboxylic acid (1 mmol, 0.190 g). Finally, methanolic solution (10 mL) of 1,2-bis(4-pyridyl)ethane (1 mmol, 0.184 g) was added to it and stirred for 40 min at room temperature and then filtered. After a few days, colorless single crystals suitable for X-ray diffraction were obtained (yield, 78%) by slow evaporation of the filtrate. Anal. found (calcd): C, 38.01 (38.07); H, 5.77 (5.75); N, 5.54 (5.55); Mn, 10.89 (10.90). IR: ν(COO-):  1333, 1619 cm-1; ν(O−H):  3500−3300 cm-1.
elements.clean_text: Experimental Section. An aqueous solution (5 mL) of MnCl2⋅4H2O (1 mmol, 0.197 g) was mixed with an aqueous solution (5 mL) of dipotassium salt of acetylene dicarboxylic acid (1 mmol, 0.190 g). Finally, methanolic solution (10 mL) of 1,2-bis(4-pyridyl)ethane (1 mmol, 0.184 g) was added to it and stirred for 40 min at room temperature and then filtered. After a few days, colorless single crystals suitable for X-ray diffraction were obtained (yield, 78%) by slow evaporation of the filtrate. Anal. found (calcd): C, 38.01 (38.07); H, 5.77 (5.75); N, 5.54 (5.55); Mn, 10.89 (10.90). IR: ν(COO-): 1333, 1619 cm-1; ν(O-H): 3500-3300 cm-1.

metadata.title:
A Three-Dimensional Honeycomb-Like Network Constructed with
Novel “Sinusoidal” One-Dimensional Chains via Hydrogen Bonding
and π−π Interactions
